events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (RDRC Edition)
events.description: Southeast Asia’s largest Ruby conference, Red Dot Ruby Conference, is back! Rails Girls Singapore is joining forces with RDRC to bring you this special edition of Rails Girls. How special, you ask? We will be inviting Linda Liukas, the founder of Rails Girls, coming to speak to us all the way from Helsinki, Finland! Linda is the author and illustrator of Hello Ruby, a childrens picture book about the whimsical world of computers, as well as the founder of Rails Girls, a global movement to teach young women programming in over 220 cities. She loves Muji, Zelda Fitzgerald, software and sparkly things. On top of that, you will also hear a special talk by Vaidehi Joshi. She is formerly a teacher, sometimes a writer, and currently a web developer at Friends of The Web in Baltimore, Maryland. Vaidehi is a graduate of the Flatiron School and a big time cheesecake enthusiast. Join us in learning Rails on 6th June! Light snacks will be provided. Agenda : 09:30 - 09:45 Registration 09:45 - 10:00 Introduction + Break into Groups 10:00 - 10:15 Address by Linda Liukas 10:15 - 11:30 Code 11:30 - 11:45 Break 11:45 - 12:00 Experience of Flatiron School by Vaidehi Joshi 12:00 - 13:15 Code 13:15 - 13:30 Closeup ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please drop us an email at elisha@learnemy.com or stania@thoughtworks.com and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Michael - Sheng Loong - Lachlan - Steven Yap - Jack Chen Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Elisha (elisha@learnemy.com) and Tania (stania@thoughtworks.com).
events.location: IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, 188969, Singapore

events.name: Conversations  With Claire Nouvian and Lynette Wallworth
events.description: Expression Gallery, Level 4 Saturday, 6 June l 2.30pm - 4pm Don’t miss this opportunity to hear curator Claire Nouvian and artist Lynette Wallworth discuss their marine conservation work and the inspiration behind it. Chaired by ArtScience Museum’s Executive Director Honor Harger. Free admission.

events.name: Github Patchwork Singapore
events.description: Patchwork is a hands on workshop for learning Git and GitHub. Please RSVP at GrumpyGits
events.location: IDA Labs @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, Singapore

events.description: 前回好評につき、第二回飲み会を開催したいと思います！今回はRedDotRubyConfの時期に合わせて開催します。 場所は人数がある程度集まり次第決定し、再度ご連絡します。 みなさんのご参加お待ちしています！

events.name: Hebocon Singapore: InnovAsean SEA Makerspace Summit Edition
events.description: The HEBOCON SINGAPORE will be held at Home-Fix XPC (19 Tai Seng Avenue) during the networking party on the 6th June 7pm, held in conjunction with the InnovAsean: SEA Makerspace Summit We will co-host this event together with our maker friends from Maker Zoo Bangkok and Foresight : Young Innovators' Studios Attendance to the Hebocon event is FREE. However, if you like to join us for the networking dinner, there will be additional cost of $50/pax for catering. About HEBOCON: Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. This event will serve as a testbed for the organizers to improve the competition processes leading to the HEBOCON main event in July. Thank you. For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
